content.description: The diagonal crack that joins Toe of Frog at the roof.
content.location: Eye of Newt, Toe of Frog, Wool of Bat, and Tongue of Dog all share the same anchor above The Cauldron Roof on the left side of Elixir Wall.

content.description: Shared start with Strange Brew. Scramble up to ledge. Continue up bolt protected face. At the third bolt, move left and up sustained face to beautiful left leaning finger and hand crack. This is a bit of a squeeze job, but a challenging lead will reward those who stay true to the line and avoid using Strange Brew.
content.protection: 7 bolts. Gear to #1 Camalot. A few slings to manage rope drag.

climbs.name: Tongue of Dog
climbs.fa: Unknown. Some old tat was found 2/3 the way up this route.

content.description: Corner feature right of Cauldron Roof
content.location: Eye of Newt, Toe of Frog, Wool of Bat, and Tongue of Dog all share the same anchor above The Cauldron Roof on the left side of Elixir Wall.

climbs.name: Toe of Frog
climbs.fa: Jim Barnes, Mark Lovell, Joy Engblade 7/2016

content.location: Eye of Newt, Toe of Frog, Wool of Bat, and Tongue of Dog all share the same anchor above The Cauldron Roof on the left side of Elixir Wall.

climbs.name: Strange Brew
climbs.fa: Marc Lovell, Joy Engblade, Jim Barnes 7/2016

content.description: Scramble up to ledge, pass four bolts on steep flakey face, and continue up hand crack.

climbs.name: Mother's Milk
climbs.fa: FA: Jim Barnes, Joy Engblade, Marc Lovell 7/2016

content.description: A bouldery start (the crux) leads to a pitch of thought provoking 5.10 climbing. After clipping the 9th bolt, move up and left to crack. The crack was originally led on gear. Bolts were added later. Interesting finish. 35m. Watch rope end when lowering off!

Start as for Mother’s Milk. A cruxy start leads to a pitch of fun 5.10 climbing. After clipping the 9th bolt, continue up steep and sustained face. 35m. Shares anchor with Apothecary. Watch rope end when lowering off!

content.location: Eye of Newt, Toe of Frog, Wool of Bat, and Tongue of Dog all share the same anchor above The Cauldron Roof on the left side of Elixir Wall.

content.description:
There are two starts for this route, and both start with a single bolt. The left start is 10a. The right start up black globules is 5.9.

Watch rope end when lowering on this route.

At the second bolt, climb up and left into wide crack.  This route shares the same anchor with Mama’s Magic Milk. Lower off. 35m.

climbs.name: Alchemy
climbs.fa: Joy Engblade, Marc Lovell, Jim Barnes 7/2016

content.description:
There are two starts for this route, and both start with a single bolt. The left start is 10a. The right start up black blobs is 5.9.

Climb one of two starts that leads to a continuous finger crack that finishes in a right facing corner. Excellent! 35m. This is a long lower off! Pay attention to the rope end when lowering!
content.protection: 3 bolts. Gear tiny to #1 Camalot. Offset cams are helpful. Pro is tricky at times.
